intro: Rubus × lugiacus, commonly known as the hybrid blackberry or loganberry, is a deciduous shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is a natural hybrid between Rubus ursinus (blackberry) and Rubus pectoralis (loganberry), resulting in a plant with unique characteristics. The plant produces large, dark purple to black berries that are typically larger and sweeter than those of its parent species. Its thorny stems and compound leaves are typical of the Rubus genus, while its fruit has a more complex flavor profile. This hybrid is often cultivated for its culinary and ornamental value in temperate regions.
